learning_objective: Modify, remix, or incorporate portions of an existing program into one's own work, to develop something new or add more advanced features.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is working on a project to analyze customer reviews from an e-commerce website for a market research. They have access to a library that can scrape reviews from websites, and another library that can perform sentiment analysis on text. How can Alex remix these components to create a new program that not only fetches reviews but also analyzes sentiment?",
    "Answer1": "Create a new program that uses the scraping library to fetch reviews, then input each review into the sentiment analysis library.",
    "Answer2": "Create two separate programs: one for scraping reviews and the other for sentiment analysis.",
    "Answer3": "Run the sentiment analysis library on the whole website instead of individual reviews.",
    "Answer4": "Use the scraping library to fetch reviews and print them, without any sentiment analysis.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "The concept of remixing in coding involves constructing new programs by reusing and re-configuring existing blocks of code. Alex can create a new, single program that imports and utilizes both the scraping library and the sentiment analysis library to achieve the desired result. This is a more efficient solution than creating two separate programs or ignoring the sentiment analysis entirely."
}
